alert.note: Alert for Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 9:56AM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Rhode Island, including the following counties, Kent and Providence. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 950 AM EST, gauge reports indicated heavy rainfall from yesterday resulted in flooding. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Providence, Cranston, Pawtucket, East Providence, Coventry, North Providence, West Warwick, Johnston, Smithfield, Lincoln, Seekonk, East Greenwich, Scituate, Glocester and West Greenwich. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
